00011 /* Debugging messages (default: off) */
00012 u32 showDebug = 0;
00013 
00014 
00021 void debugOn(std::ostream& os, const int& level)
00022 {
00023         /* Setting the debug level to 0 is the same as turning it off. */
00024         if (0 == level)
00025         {
00026                 debugOff(os);
00027                 return;
00028         }
00029 
00030         /* These are defined in "Debug.h", and are used here to show the user what
00031          * level of error details will be displayed.
00032          */
00033         std::vector<std::string> warningLevels;
00034         warningLevels.push_back("CRITICAL_LEVEL");
00035         warningLevels.push_back("ERROR_LEVEL");
00036         warningLevels.push_back("WARNING_LEVEL");
00037         warningLevels.push_back("SUGGESTION_LEVEL");
00038         warningLevels.push_back("VERBOSE_LEVEL4");
00039         warningLevels.push_back("VERBOSE_LEVEL3");
00040         warningLevels.push_back("VERBOSE_LEVEL2");
00041         warningLevels.push_back("VERBOSE_LEVEL1");
00042 
00043         showDebug = level;
00044 
00045         if (showDebug >= warningLevels.size())
00046                 showDebug = warningLevels.size() - 1;
00047 
00048         /* This is to prevent an out-of-range error if someone updates the enum
00049          * in Debug.h without also updating this list.
00050          */
00051         Monday_out(showDebug, os, "Setting debug ON to level %d (%s).\n",
00052                    showDebug, warningLevels[showDebug].c_str());
00053 
00054         /* And this warns the stupid person of the problem mentioned above. */
00055         if (warningLevels.size() < NUM_DEBUG_DEFINITIONS)
00056         {
00057                 std::cerr << "*CRITICAL ERROR: The LevelDefinitions enum in Debug.h has "
00058                           << NUM_DEBUG_DEFINITIONS << " definitions, while the warningLevels vector in debugOn() only has "
00059                           << warningLevels.size() << " defined.  Update debugOn().\n";
00060                 return;
00061         }
00062 }
00063 
00064 
00071 void debugOff(std::ostream& os)
00072 {
00073         showDebug = 0;
00074         Monday_out(showDebug, os, "Turning debug OFF.\n");
00075 }

00082 void Monday_assert(const char* e, const char* file, int line)
00083 {
00084         std::cout << "assert() failed at " << file << ":" << line << ":\n\t" << e << std::endl;
00085         exit(0);
00086 }

00089 void Monday_log(const std::string& e, const char* file, int line)
00090 {
00091         std::cout << file << ":" << line << ":" << " Log: " << e << std::endl;
00092 }

00113 void Monday_out(const u32 &debugLevel, std::ostream& os, const char* msg, ...)
00114 {
00115         /* Messages are only displayed when debugLevel <= showDebug */
00116         if (debugLevel <= showDebug)
00117         {
00118                 char buf[1024];
00119 
00120                 va_list ap;
00121                 va_start(ap, msg);
00122                 vsprintf(buf, msg, ap);
00123                 va_end(ap);
00124 
00125                 os << buf;
00126         }
00127 }

00129 
00141 void Show_attributes(std::ostream& os, Attributes& attributes)
00142 {
00143         Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, os, "- Num attributes: %d\n", attributes.size());
00144         for(Attributes::iterator i = attributes.begin(); i != attributes.end(); ++i)
00145         {
00146                 Monday_out(VERBOSE_LEVEL2, os, "  \"%s\" = \"%s\"\n", i->first.c_str(), i->second.c_str());
00147         }
00148 }
